_metadata.description: School tier assignments for private student loan risk adjustment. Tiers are derived from U.S. Department of Education College Scorecard data, focusing on completion rates and post-graduation earnings outcomes.

data_sources.name: U.S. Department of Education College Scorecard
key_metrics: C150_4 or equivalent: 150% of normal time graduation rate (primarily 6-year rate for bachelor's)
MD_EARN_WNE_P10: Median earnings of students working and not enrolled 10 years after entry
data_sources.data_as_of: November 2025 release (latest available as of February 2026)

data_sources.name: Supplementary validation
sources: Georgetown Center on Education and the Workforce (CEW) ROI 2025 Rankings
National Student Clearinghouse Completing College reports (for national benchmarks)
Institutional self-reported data and IPEDS where Scorecard gaps exist

tier_thresholds_guidance.Tier 1 (Low Risk): Graduation rate ≥ 75–80% AND median earnings ≥ $70,000–$80,000 (top performers)
tier_thresholds_guidance.Tier 3 (High Risk): Graduation rate <60% OR earnings < $50,000, or limited/no data (conservative default)
tier_thresholds_guidance.notes: Thresholds are illustrative and adjustable based on portfolio risk appetite. Wyoming Catholic College uses proxy/1-year earnings due to no federal aid participation and limited Scorecard coverage.

_metadata.maintainer_note: Refresh from College Scorecard annually or after major releases. Use OPEID (6-digit) as primary key for accuracy; fallback to normalized school name for unmatched entries.
